title: Where can I study medicine in English, with no tuition, anywhere in the world? - Quora

response.answer_text: HI. Let’s distinguish between the “study” of medicine and the “practice” of medicine. You can “study” medicine at home. You can “study” medicine as a volunteer at a hospital. You can “study” medicine at any variety of clinics. However, to “practice” medicine, to be a doctor, is something different. This requires long years of study resulting in a government-issued certificate after extensive testing. This means paying tuition for up to 8 years. It’s an expensive commitment. But I would suggest that if you do not go that route, if you try to cut corners by attending some institution that offers a half-baked useless piece of paper as a certificate, then you are doing yourself and your patients a great injustice. There is an attitude problem here. Why not try to get into the absolute best medical college available to you? You can explore scholarships. You can ask for help from family. You can work part-time. It can be done if you have the energy and perseverance to do it. You owe this to yourself and your patients to get the absolute best education you can. Lives depend on it. Get busy!!

There is no EU nationality. As I said in another answer, I am very doubtful that medicine studies in any country would not be in the national language. Doctors must be able to communicate with their patients!
